member.summary: Load the strings for the current culture

member.name: P:LOCCounter.ExtensionsForm.ExtList
member.summary: Get the list of extensions chosen by the user. Open the form as a modal dialog, and this property will be set when the dialog closes. Empty if the user canceled the extensions dialog.

member.name: M:LOCCounter.ExtensionsForm.Apply
member.summary: Check the state of each checkbox and construct a string representing the chosen extensions.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.ExtensionsForm.DefaultCheckboxes
member.summary: Get the list of default extension checkboxes, not including the custom checkboxes. The tag of each checkbox contains the associated extension.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.ExtensionsForm.CustomCheckboxes
member.summary: Get the list of customizable extension checkboxes, not including the default checkboxes. The tag of each checkbox contains the associated extension.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.ExtensionsForm.CustomPanels
member.summary: Get the list of panels contaning customizable extension checkboxes.

member.summary: Move the form to a spot relative to the owner.

member.summary: Save the checked boxes and return.

member.summary: Return with an empty selection list.

member.summary: Check all the default checkboxes and also the custom checkboxes that have text.

member.summary: Uncheck all the checkboxes.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp00
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to LOCCounter.exe, Sloc.dll and LOCCounter.exe.config should all be in the same folder..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp01
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A blank line contains only white space. A comment line begins with a comment delimiter or is a line between comment delimiters (according to the file extension as defined in CommentDelimiters.xml). A line that begins as a comment but contains code is considered to be a comment, e.g.,.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp02
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to /* cmnt */ x = 1;.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp03
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A line that begins with code but contains a comment is considered to be code. Lines that are not blank and not commented are considered Source Lines of Code (SLOC). A line that begins with code and then (on the same line) starts (but does not terminate) a multi-line comment will cause incorrect results, e.g.,.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp04
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to x = 1; /* Start comment.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp05
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to this counted as code because previous line starts with code..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp06
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This program first collects the list of files in and under a root folder with any extension in the selectable list. LOCCounter.exe.config may be modified to handle more file types. For unknown file types, the program assumes that comments are delimited as with the C programming language (//, /*, */)..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp07
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to HTML files may use comments to hide embedded javascript from non-compliant browsers. Those script lines will be treated as comments..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp08
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Performance can be slow for files with tens of thousands of lines, so if you have folders full of huge XML data files, you could see long execution times. Try removing some of the file extensions from the list. The Cancel button is generally ineffective while the program first begins to collect the list of files. If your source tree is very large, the collection process can take a while..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp09
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Once a directory has been counted, a file can be opened in Notepad by clicking with the right mouse button..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp10
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to To view the subtotals for a group of files, select any items in the list with the left mouse button, then use the right mouse button with the menu command. To view the subtotals for an extension, first sort the File Type column to make it easy to select the files. Use CTRL-C to copy the contents of the popup window to the clipboard..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp11
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A 'feature' of Windows is that files with extensions longer than 3 characters have a short 8.3 name with an extension that has three characters. For example, when processing HTM files, HTML files may also be processed. This program does not correct for that..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resHelp12
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Use 'LOCCounterStd.exe /?' at the command line to see command line options..

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resLines
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Lines.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resSourceLOC
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Source LOC.

member.name: P:LOCCounter.Resources.Strings.resUseStd
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Use LOCCounterStd.exe to send output to a file..
